item.title: AutoTalker Help (My AutoTalker)
item.dc:creator: @Shadower Shadower
item.description:
@Shadower wrote:

Change this:

const
Talk:='Text here' //what to say
TWait:=1000//time to wait after typing

to this:

const
Talk='Text here'; //what to say
TWait=1000;//time to wait after typing

You forgot the semi-colon to signify the end, like a full stop.
Btw don’t use SendKeySilent, it is way too detectable because it very, very, extremely detectable.
Do this:

Program AutoTalker;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar} //uses the SRL include. Download SRL if you don't have it

Then do this:

TypeSend(Talk); // The new one does not require the enter key because it is built in to SRL to use put a 'enter'

Read full topic

item.title: AutoTalker Help (My AutoTalker)
item.dc:creator: @jvwarrior jvwarrior
item.description:
@jvwarrior wrote:

ok well im trying to test an autotalker i made (available in section of first scripts) but everytime I try to run it i get this error -
Failed when compiling
Line 4: [Error] (4:5): is (’=’) expected in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 3.12\Scripts\AutoTalker.scar

I looked over it but I dont know what i did wrong cause wel Im new can someone help me out. Heres the code:

[code]program AutoTalker;

const
Talk:=‘Text here’ //what to say
TWait:=1000//time to wait after typing

procedure TalkOn;
begin
repeat
Wait(TWait+random(700));
SendKeysSilent(Talk+chr(13)); // types text in talk and presses enter
until(false); //False = never ends
end;

begin
repeat
TalkOn;
until(true) //keeps going until true… wich i cant remember what true is… =(
end.[/code]

Read full topic
